section: Section A: The Organism and Its Environment
objective: Understand the basic building blocks of life and matter.
content: Properties of matter, cell structure, and the organization of life. Focuses on the differences between plant and animal cells.
specific_objectives: Distinguish between living and non-living things
Describe the structure and function of animal and plant cells
Explain the concept of specialized cells (e.g., sperm, egg, nerve cells)
Discuss the organization of life: cell -> tissue -> organ -> system -> organism
Identify states of matter and changes of state

section: Section A: The Organism and Its Environment
objective: Analyze the mechanisms of life continuation.
content: Sexual and asexual reproduction in plants and humans. Focuses on the human reproductive system and birth control.
specific_objectives: Differentiate between sexual and asexual reproduction
Identify the parts of the human male and female reproductive systems
Explain the menstrual cycle and the process of fertilization
Discuss various methods of birth control (hormonal, barrier, natural)
Explain the stages of growth and development in humans

section: Section A: The Organism and Its Environment
content: Balanced diets, food groups, and the impact of lifestyle on health. Focuses on infectious vs non-infectious diseases.
specific_objectives: Identify the major food groups and their functions
Discuss the consequences of an unbalanced diet (malnutrition)
Distinguish between infectious and non-infectious diseases
Explain the prevention and control of common diseases (e.g., diabetes, hypertension, AIDS)
Analyze the impact of drug abuse on health

section: Section B: The Home and Workplace
objective: Apply safety principles in various environments.
content: Workplace hazards, safety gear, and basic first aid for accidents.
specific_objectives: Identify common hazards in the home and workplace
Explain the use of protective clothing and safety equipment
Demonstrate basic first aid for burns, cuts, and electric shock
Identify different types of fire extinguishers and their uses

section: Section B: The Home and Workplace
objective: Understand the use and conservation of energy.
content: Forms of energy, electrical circuits in the home, and energy efficiency.
specific_objectives: Identify different forms of energy (kinetic, potential, solar)
Explain the difference between series and parallel circuits
Calculate the cost of electricity based on wattage and usage duration
Discuss ways to conserve energy in the household

section: Section C: Earth's Place in the Universe
objective: Understand Earth's planetary context and environmental issues.
content: The solar system, seasons, and the importance of the atmosphere. Focuses on pollution and climate change.
specific_objectives: Describe the structure of the solar system
Explain the causes of day/night and the seasons
Analyze the causes and effects of air and water pollution
Discuss the greenhouse effect and global warming
Explain the importance of the ozone layer
